mapper.sql: t.id as t_id, t.mac_name as t_mac_name, t."mac_ series" as "t_mac_ series", t.mac_type as t_mac_type, t."mac_ manufacturer" as "t_mac_ manufacturer", t.mac_user as t_mac_user, t.mac_work_time as t_mac_work_time, t.mac_state as t_mac_state, t.create_time as t_create_time, t.update_time as t_update_time, t.operator_id as t_operator_id, t.state as t_state, t.mac_org as t_mac_org, t.updator_id as t_updator_id, t.creator as t_creator
mapper.insert: insert into machine (id, mac_name, "mac_ series", mac_type, "mac_ manufacturer", mac_user, mac_work_time, mac_state, create_time, update_time, operator_id, state, mac_org, updator_id, creator ) values (#{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}, #{macName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{macSeries,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{macType,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{macManufacturer,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{macUser,jdbcType=BIGINT}, #{macWorkTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{macState,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{operatorId,jdbcType=BIGINT}, #{state,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{macOrg,jdbcType=BIGINT}, #{updatorId,jdbcType=BIGINT}, #{creator,jdbcType=VARCHAR} )

update machine
mac_name = #{macName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
"mac_ series" = #{macSeries,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
mac_type = #{macType,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
"mac_ manufacturer" = #{macManufacturer,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
mac_user = #{macUser,jdbcType=BIGINT},
mac_work_time = #{macWorkTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},

create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},

mac_org = #{macOrg,jdbcType=BIGINT},
updator_id = #{updatorId,jdbcType=BIGINT},
creator = #{creator,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}
